definition: to get sth off one's chest
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to vomit/to throw up
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
rapid/quick/speed/rate/soon/almost/to make haste/clever/sharp (of knives or wits)/forthright/plainspoken/gratified/pleased/pleasant

sentences.english: I couldn't go to sleep without getting something off my chest.
sentences.chinese: 我假如不将心事一吐为快就睡不着。

sentences.english: If you have questions to ask me, say it airily .
sentences.chinese: 妳如果有问题就告诉我，把它说出来一吐为快吧。

sentences.english: He had no choice except to spit it out.
sentences.chinese: 逼得他无所适从，只好一吐为快。

sentences.english: Because I couldn't tell you to your face.
sentences.chinese: 我早就想一吐为快，只是怕对付你这张发怒的脸。

sentences.english: All right, I'll spit it out.
Getting things off your chest will improve your mood.
sentences.chinese: 把事情一吐为快会改善你的心情。

sentences.english: He will have a terrible itch in his throat—itch to speak out.
sentences.chinese: 喉间硬是痒得出奇，思一吐为快。

sentences.english: There is mind in your heart obviously, why not say it out?
sentences.chinese: 你显然有心事，为何不一吐为快？

definition: to have to pour out what's on one's mind (idiom)
to say everything (that is on one's mind)
(to express one's) true feelings/what is on one's mind/secret mind
lit. fluently saying all one wants (idiom); to preach freely on one's favorite topic/to hold forth to one's heart's content
to pour forth (one's opinions)
to pour out (emotions)/to unburden oneself (of strong feelings)/to vomit comprehensively
to give vent to (one's feelings)
pent-up frustrations/sth that has accumulated in one's mind for a long time
to drain (by leading off water)/to unburden oneself/to divulge/to leak a secret
to express (an emotion)/to give vent
to speak one's mind
lit. as if having a fish bone stuck in one's throat (idiom)/fig. very upset and needing to express one's displeasure
to mediate/to reconcile/to make peace/to intervene
to suffer from pent-up frustrations/mental knot/emotional issue
bitter water (e.g. mineral water containing sulfates)/suffering/digestive fluids rising from stomach to the mouth/fig. bitter complaint
depressed/dejected/feeling low
